Hi Ken, I found the ideas in this paper very interesting. However, =
in the provided matlab code I noted that part of the learning happens post =
hoc. For example, when the agent veers away from the wall or the wrong food=
 type, synaptic plasticity increases. It means that part of the learning is=
 not only a result of direct punishment (e.g. the vehicle hits the wall) bu=
t of a subsequent positive neuromodulation ones the vehicle managed to get =
away from the wall. I wondered whether the agent would be able to learn the=
 correct behavior without the reward for fleeing?

In general, it could be =
interesting to analyse the concept that stopping punishment immediately res=
ults in short-term reward.
